definition: lit. the gate of a noble house is like the sea/there is a wide gap between the nobility and the common people (idiom)

surname Hou

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
to seem/to appear/to resemble/similar/-like/pseudo-/(more) than
old variant of 似[si4]

ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai

without news from sb (idiom)
to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
autumnal sadness
overgrown gate, wicker windows (idiom); poor person's house/humble home
lit. when one grass burns the other grass sighs (idiom); fig. to have sympathy with a like-minded person in distress

out of one's mind
a single day apart seems like three seasons (idiom)

to make known to every household (idiom); to disseminate widely/to shout from the rooftops
lit. clouds scatter, wind flows (idiom); the crisis settles down/people disperse home/things return to normal
to go to the brothel on horseback (idiom); to visit prostitutes
